meanings.definition: A test that is part of a larger test, typically focusing on a specific skill or area of knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The math subtests were challenging for the students.
meanings.sent2: She completed all the subtests in the science exam.
meanings.sent3: The subtests in history made the students feel like time travelers.
meanings.sent4: The subtests acted as puzzle pieces in the overall assessment.
meanings.sent5: The subtests were like small quizzes within the big test.

meanings.definition: To administer or take a subtest as part of a larger assessment.
meanings.sent1: The teacher subtests the students on vocabulary every week.
meanings.sent2: He subtests the participants to evaluate their progress.
meanings.sent3: The students subtest each other to practice for the final exam.
meanings.sent4: She subtests her knowledge before the big test.
meanings.sent5: Subtesting helps in understanding individual strengths and weaknesses.
